text: <@U1HFNJB50|c0rwin> has joined the channel
anybody? :S
<@U0KM61BCP>: i see there are new submissions against v0.6 (<https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/q/status:open+branch:v0.6>)
should we be considering these for a potential v0.6.2 release, or is the branch closed?

my hope was that we would only accept 2 types of PRs for v0.6 branch:

1) fix bugs found by people trying to use the Docker images in the wild
2) if we wanted to merge in any build changes to add support for Power and/or Z for both build and CI

I'd like fabric users to focus on building chaincode and apps with v0.6 and fabric developers to help with v1.0 work.  Of course advanced users should be using v1.0 builds once we have the basics going

<@U0KPFAZNF> I feel like we really should shift people to the v1.0 work- this is what community decided on in general at the hackathons and through all the specification work (like SDK workgroup), right?  I can see basic bug fixes as Gari Singh has commented on, but major features seems like should be focused on what community decided upon.

i dont have a super strong opinion either way, but I was under the impression that the branch was closed for the reasons you mentioned (community focus, etc) but then was surprised when more CRs came in
so the question now is: what to do about them? review/accept, or redirect to master?
as long as not major bug- i say redirect to master
<https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/1931/>  Got one +2… anybody got a 2nd +2?  Would prefer not to refactor again :slightly_smiling_face:
…due to other incoming merges
oh - I can't help - +2 was from me on that one  :wink:
<@U0ULK2JPP>  - can you check out <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/1931/>
Reviewed, approved and merged...
<@U0PB67X4K>  sorry, was away for a bit… and thanks <@U11MANG9G>
now I have to rebase :slightly_smiling_face: … ‘venge time eh, <@U1KFCPFQA> ?
Ha ha :wink:
<@U11MANG9G> thanks!  <@U0ULK2JPP> couldn’t let you win twice in a row :slightly_smiling_face:
:slightly_smiling_face:
<@U0PB67X4K>: we do need docs that match 0.6 and right now they don't
but that said no other changes than what you described
<https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/1895>, can someone take a look and review/merge please? i’ve reviewed it and got it updated to my satisfaction :wink:
<@U11HTMW0H|bmos299> has joined the channel

<@U0PB67X4K> <@U0KM61BCP> we have been working on automated testing to include daily runs, and long runs as well as enhanced behave tests and performance testing on .6.  This same testing methodology would then be developed on 1.0 as the code moves forward.  Is it ok for these check-ins? We have a good bit of work to check in.
